content: Siberia experiences extreme temperatures during both winter and summer months. In winter, temperatures in Siberia can drop to as low as -50°C (-58°F) or even lower, while in summer, temperatures can reach up to 30°C (86°F) or higher in some areas. This means that there is a significant difference in temperatures between winter and summer in Siberia, with winter being much colder and summer being much warmer.
